TI ANTIHYPERTENSIVE ACTION OF THE NOVEL ANGIOTENSIN
   CONVERTING-ENZYME-INHIBITOR BENAZEPRIL HYDROCHLORIDE IN HYPERTENSIVE RAT
   MODELS
SO ARZNEIMITTEL-FORSCHUNG/DRUG RESEARCH
LA English
DT Article
DE ANGIOTENSIN CONVERTING ENZYME INHIBITORS; ANTIHYPERTENSIVES; BENAZEPRIL
   HYDROCHLORIDE, PHARMACOLOGY; CAS 86541-74-4; CGS 14824 A
AB Single or repeated administration of benazepril hydrochloride (CGS 14824 A, CAS 86541-74-4), a novel angiotensin I converting enzyme inhibitor, (0.3-10 mg/kg p.o.) caused significant antihypertensive effects in renal and spontaneously hypertensive rats (SHR).  The antihypertensive effect of benazepril hydrochloride was about 3 times as potent as that of captopril in these models.  Single administration (0.3-3 mg/kg p.o.) of benazepril hydrochloride and enalapril maleate showed an equipotent antihypertensive effect in SHR.  Benazepril hydrochloride (3-30 mg/kg p.o.), however, showed no clear effect on the blood pressure and heart rate in normotensive or DOCA/salt hypertensive rats.
C1 CIBA GEIGY JAPAN LTD,DIV RES & DEV SUBDIV PHARMACEUT,PRECLIN RES DEPT,BIOL RES LAB,TAKARAZUKA,JAPAN.

TI HIGHLY RELIABLE 150 MW CW OPERATION OF SINGLE-STRIPE ALGAAS LASERS WITH
   WINDOW GROWN ON FACETS
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE SEMICONDUCTOR LASER; AIGAAS; HIGH POWER; HIGH RELIABILITY; WINDOW;
   NONABSORBING MIRROR; CLEAVED FACET; PASSIVATION; METAL ORGANIC CHEMICAL
   VAPOR DEPOSITION
ID SUBSTRATE
AB High-power single-stripe AlGaAs lasers with a new type of window structure named "window grown on facets (WGF)" are described here for the first time.  In the lasers, window layers have been grown on cleaved (110) facets, independent of the internal laser structures.  A stable fundamental transverse mode has been obtained up to more than 200 mW of output power in the wavelength range of 830 nm.  No obvious degradation has been observed beyond 2000 hours under 100 mW and 150 mW CW operation at 50-degrees-C.
C1 SHARP CO LTD,DIV OPTO-ELECTR DEVICES,YAMATO KORIYAMA,NARA 63911,JAPAN.

TI BEAM PROFILE CONTROLLER IN A NEUTRAL BEAM SYSTEM
SO FUSION TECHNOLOGY
LA English
DT Article
DE BEAM PROFILE CONTROLLER; NEUTRAL BEAM SYSTEM; PLASMA CURRENT PROFILE
   CONTROL
ID TOKAMAK
AB The concept and the technical bases of a beam profile controller for a neutral beam injector to realize plasma current profile control in tokamak devices are proposed.  Beam orbits of ions emitted from the ion source are controlled magnetically by the beam profile controller before entering the neutralizer.  By making use of this beam profile control system, a different neutral beam intensity profile can be realized at the torus plasma without changing the neutral beam power level during one pulse of beam injection.

TI POLARIZATION DIVERSITY TECHNIQUES FOR THE USE OF COHERENT OPTICAL FIBER
   SUBMARINE CABLE SYSTEMS
SO JOURNAL OF LIGHTWAVE TECHNOLOGY
LA English
DT Article
ID FSK TRANSMISSION EXPERIMENT
AB Recent research and development works on coherent transmission systems, especially with emphasis on its application to optical fiber submarine cable systems, are described.  First, we demonstrate the feasibility of polarization diversity scheme in a laboratory environment as well as in the first sea trial of coherent FSK system.  Then we propose a novel external cavity laser module and a polarization coupling/dividing module in order to improve the system performance.  We are convinced by these experiments that we will be able to use the coherent technologies in practical submarine cable systems in the near future.

TI CATALYTIC PROPERTIES OF HUMAN PLATELET 12-LIPOXYGENASE AS COMPARED WITH
   THE ENZYMES OF OTHER ORIGINS
SO BIOCHIMICA ET BIOPHYSICA ACTA
LA English
DT Article
DE 12-LIPOXYGENASE; LIPOXIN; ARACHIDONIC ACID; (HUMAN PLATELET)
ID PORCINE LEUKOCYTES; ARACHIDONATE 12-LIPOXYGENASE; LIPOXIN SYNTHESIS;
   BOVINE PLATELETS; ACID; LIPOXYGENASE; LEUKOTRIENE-A4; BIOSYNTHESIS;
   CONVERSION
AB Arachidonate 12-lipoxygenases of porcine and bovine leukocytes were different in substrate specificity and immunogenicity from the enzyme of bovine platelets (Arch. Biochem. Biophys. (1988) 266, 613).  In order to extend the comparative studies on the two types of 12-lipoxygenase, we purified theenzyme from the cytosol of human platelets by immunoaffinity chromatography to a specific activity of about 0.3-mu-mol/min per mg protein at 37-degrees-C.  The purified enzyme was active with eicosapolyenoic acids and docosahexaenoic acid.  Linoleic and linolenic acids were poor substrates in contrast to the high reactivity of the leukocyte enzymes with these octadecapolyenoic acids.  The finding that the human platelet enzyme catalyzed 15-oxygenation of 5S-hydroxy-6,8,11,14-eicosatetraenoic acid, raised a question if lipoxins were produced by incubation of the enzyme with leukotriene A4.  However, the leukotriene A4 was scarcely transformed to lipoxin isomers by 12-lipoxygenases of human and bovine platelets.  In sharp contrast, the porcine and bovine leukocyte enzymes converted leukotriene A4 to various lipoxin isomers by the reaction rates of 3% and 2% of the arachidonate 12-oxygenation.  Thus, 12-lipoxygenases of human and bovine platelets were catalytically distinct from the porcine and bovine leukocyte enzymes in terms of their reactivities not only with linoleic and linolenic acids, but also with leukotriene A4 as lipoxin precursor.
C1 UNIV TOKUSHIMA,SCH MED,DEPT BIOCHEM,TOKUSHIMA 770,JAPAN.
CR CLAEYS M, 1985, BIOCHIM BIOPHYS ACTA, V837, P35, DOI 10.1016/0005-2760(85)90083-9

TI MEASUREMENTS OF FARADAY-EFFECT IN IRON-GARNET OPTICAL WAVE-GUIDE AT
   NEAR-INFRARED WAVELENGTHS
SO JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 35TH ANNUAL CONF ON MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
CY OCT 29-NOV 01, 1990
CL SAN DIEGO, CA
SP AMER INST PHYS, IEEE, MAGNET SOC, AMER INST MIN MET & PETR ENGINEERS, MET SOC, USN, OFF NAVAL RES, AMER SOC TESTING & MAT, AMER PHYS SOC, AMER CERAM SOC
ID PHASE
AB The Faraday rotation constants in a magneto-optic channel waveguide whose magnetization aligns along the direction of propagation are measured by a novel method developed by the authors.  The tested sample is a lanthanum and gallium substituted yttrium iron garnet optical channel waveguide prepared by the liquid phase epitaxial and the ion milling techniques.  The proposed method is more practical than the previously reported one because of determination of the parameters with one time measurement.  In the previous method we needed to know the phase constant difference between the orthogonally polarized waves to determine the Faraday coefficient.  Using the presented technique we successfully measure the magneto-optic coefficients in the iron garnet waveguide at the near infrared wavelengths:  1.15, 1.3, and 1.55-mu-m.  We confirm the validity of the proposed method by comparing with other methods:  the previously reported method and the Faraday modulation method conventionally used for measuring the Faraday rotation.  We also demonstrate the waveguide isolator operation.
RP OKAMURA, Y (reprint author), OSAKA UNIV,FAC ENGN SCI,DEPT ELECT ENGN,1-1 MACHIKANEYAMA CHO,TOYONAKA,OSAKA 560,JAPAN.

TI LABORATORY OBSERVATION OF THE 3P1-3P0 TRANSITION OF THE NEUTRAL
   CARBON-ATOM BY SUBMILLIMETER-WAVE ABSORPTION-SPECTROSCOPY
SO ASTROPHYSICAL JOURNAL
LA English
DT Article
DE ATOMIC PROCESSES; INTERSTELLAR, ABUNDANCES; LABORATORY SPECTRA
ID LASER MAGNETIC-RESONANCE; INTER-STELLAR CLOUDS; STEADY-STATE MODELS;
   FINE-STRUCTURE; ASTRONOMICAL IDENTIFICATION; INTERSTELLAR CLOUDS;
   HYDROSTATIC MODELS; MOLECULAR CLOUDS; CHAIN MOLECULE; GROUND-STATE
AB The 3P1-3P0 transitions of the neutral C-12 and C-13 atoms are observed by laboratory microwave spectroscopy.  The carbon atom is produced by discharging a gaseous mixture of CO and He at the liquid nitrogen temperature.  The transition frequency is precisely determined for C-12(I) to be 492160.651 +/- 0.055 MHz, where the error is three standard deviations in the frequency measurements.  Two hyperfine components, F = 3/2-1/2 and F = 1/2-1/2, are observed  for C-13(I) at 492164.276 +/- 0.072  MHz and 492160.147 +/- 0.168 MHz, respectively.  The precise laboratory values are recommended as rest frequencies in astronomical observations.
RP YAMAMOTO, S (reprint author), NAGOYA UNIV,DEPT ASTROPHYS,CHIKUSA,NAGOYA 46401,JAPAN.

   SUNAMI, H
TI A VERSATILE 2-DIMENSIONAL ION-IMPLANTATION SIMULATOR INCORPORATED IN AN
   INTEGRATED PROCESS SIMULATION SYSTEM
SO MICROELECTRONIC ENGINEERING
LA English
DT Article
DE ION IMPLANTATION; SIMULATION; LSS THEORY; 2-DIMENSIONAL
AB A two-dimensional ion implantation simulator based on LSS theory, named ILIAD (Ion implantation simulator with LSS theory Intended for Advanced Device structures), has been developed.  ILIAD applies the LSS theory to multilayered targets of various complex shapes by dividing them into appropriate small elements.  Thus, it simulates impurity distributions in complex structures of actual devices such as a lightly doped drain MOSFET.  In addition, the shadowing effect caused by tilted ion implantation has been successfully simulated, resulting in an asymmetrical distribution under a mask.  It has been confirmed that this simulation is effective in optimizing ion implantation processes for complex device structures.
C1 HITACHI LTD,CENT RES LAB,KOKUBUNJI,TOKYO 185,JAPAN.

AU YAMAMOTO, S
   HOKAMURA, H
AF YAMAMOTO, S
   HOKAMURA, H
TI QUENCHING OF EXCITED CD(3PJ) ATOMS BY ALKANE HYDROCARBONS
SO JOURNAL OF PHYSICAL CHEMISTRY
LA English
DT Article
ID RESONANCE RADIATION; PHOTOSENSITIZED REACTION; TEMPERATURE-DEPENDENCE;
   CROSS-SECTIONS; 326.1 NM; H-2; MG(3PJ); YIELDS; D-2
AB The intensity of 326.1-nm Cd vapor resonance radiation was measured at various temperatures between 280 and 485-degrees-C and at various pressures of some alkanes.  The quenching rate constants were determined on the basis of Stern-Volmer plots, using values of the imprisonment lifetime of Cd(3P1) estimated from the quenching rate of Cd(3P(J)) by hydrogen.  The temperature dependence of the quenching rate constant for ethane, ethane-d6, propane, butane, and isobutane is expressed by the three-parameter equation k(Q) = A + B exp(-E/RT).  At 485-degrees-C the second term of the above equation dominates, and the k(Q) value shows a dependence on C-H bond strength.  This dependence can be explained by a mechanism that allows hydrogen atom abstraction by an excited cadmium atom exclusively from the weakest C-H bond.
RP YAMAMOTO, S (reprint author), OKAYAMA UNIV,FAC SCI,DEPT CHEM,3-1-1 TSUSHIMA NAKA,OKAYAMA 700,JAPAN.

TI MILLIMETER-WAVE SPECTRUM OF THE ALUMINUM MONOSULFIDE RADICAL ALS
   (X2-SIGMA+)
SO JOURNAL OF CHEMICAL PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article
ID MICROWAVE-SPECTRUM; IRC+10216; RESONANCE
AB The millimeter-wave rotational spectrum of the aluminum monosulfide radical AlS in its ground electronic state X2-SIGMA+ was observed with source-modulated spectrometer combined with a high-temperature cell.  The AlS radical was generated by a reaction between aluminum vapor and carbonyl sulfide.  Eight rotational transitions, lowest N = 4-3 and highest N = 17-16, were measured in the frequency region of 67-284 GHz and 75 observed fine and hyperfine components were analyzed by least-square methods.  The analysis yielded the rotational and centrifugal distortion constants as well as the spin-rotation coupling constant with its centrifugal term and the hyperfine coupling constants including the nuclear quadrupole coupling term for the aluminum nucleus.  The spin density of the unpaired electron was calculated by comparing the derived magnetic hyperfine coupling constants with the corresponding hyperfine coupling constants of the free aluminum atom.  Applicability of this spin density calculation is discussed.
RP TAKANO, S (reprint author), NAGOYA UNIV,FAC SCI,DEPT ASTROPHYS,CHIKUSA,NAGOYA 46401,JAPAN.

TI THE MICROWAVE-SPECTRUM OF THE DIHYDRONITROSYL RADICAL, H2NO (2B1)
SO JOURNAL OF CHEMICAL PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article
ID ELECTRON-SPIN-RESONANCE; NITROXIDE
AB The microwave rotational spectrum of the H2NO radical in the X approximately 2B1 ground vibronic state was observed by using a source-modulation spectrometer and a 1 m long free-space cell.  The H2NO radical was generated in the cell by a reaction of hydroxylamine (NH2OH) with the products of 2450 MHz discharge in CF4.  The spectral lines of H2NO were observed for the a-type R-branch transitions of N = 1<--0 to N = 6<--5, most of which showed resolved hyperfine structures due to the hydrogen and nitrogen nuclei.  The 19 molecular constants including the hyperfine coupling constants of both the nuclei were precisely determined by the least-squares fit of 129 observed lines.  The observed hyperfine structure shows that the H2NO radical in the ground electronic state is essentially planar with C2v symmetry.  The nitrogen hyperfine coupling constants determined indicate that an unpaired electron occupies the p-pi orbital perpendicular to the molecular plane, and the electronic wave function in the ground electronic state belongs to 2B1 symmetry.  However, the small but negative inertial defect (DELTA = -0.0051 U-angstrom-2) suggests a possibility that H2NO may have a double-minimum potential function for the out-of-plane vibration.
RP MIKAMI, H (reprint author), NAGOYA UNIV,FAC SCI,DEPT ASTROPHYS,CHIKUSA KU,NAGOYA 46401,JAPAN.

TI THE MICROWAVE-SPECTRUM OF THE ND2 RADICAL
SO JOURNAL OF CHEMICAL PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article
ID DOUBLE-RESONANCE SPECTRUM; LASER MAGNETIC-RESONANCE; HYPERFINE
   COUPLING-CONSTANTS; CW DYE-LASER; SPIN ROTATION CONSTANTS; GROUND-STATE;
   MOLECULAR-CONSTANTS; VIBRONIC STATE; NH2; SPECTROSCOPY
AB The rotational spectrum of the ND2 radical in the X approximately 2B1 ground state was observed in the 265-531 GHz region by using a frequency modulation spectrometer.  The ND2 radical was generated in a free space cell by a dc glow discharge in ND3, or in a mixture of N2 and D2.  One hundred twenty fine and hyperfine components of 7 rotational transitions were observed, and were analyzed by least-squares methods; this yielded the rotational and centrifugal distortion constants, as well as the spin-rotation and hyperfine coupling constants for both the nitrogen and deuterium nuclei.  The nitrogen nuclear spin-rotation constant C(aa)(N) has the anomalously large value of 0.269 +/- 0.027 (3-sigma) MHz in this analysis, but such a value is necessary to achieve the standard deviation of the fit comparable to the experimental errors.  The value is mainly caused by the relatively low-lying A approximately 2A1 electronic state.
RP KANADA, M (reprint author), NAGOYA UNIV,FAC SCI,DEPT ASTROPHYS,CHIKUSA KU,NAGOYA 46401,JAPAN.

TI EFFECTS OF NEUTRON-IRRADIATION ON CORROSION AND SEGREGATION BEHAVIOR IN
   AUSTENITIC STAINLESS-STEELS
SO JOURNAL OF NUCLEAR MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article
AB Corrosion behavior and compositional changes at grain boundaries were examined in Type 304 and 304L stainless steels irradiated up to 6 x 10(25) n/m2 (E > 1 MeV) at 323 and 573 K.  The rate of intergranular attack in boiling HNO3 + Cr6+ solution increased with increasing fluence in commercial purity stainless steels.  High purity 304L (low phosphorus and silicon) was immune to corrosion in this solution both before and after irradiation.  The enhancement of intergranular attack in commercial purity stainless steels due to irradiation was related to the increase of phosphorus and silicon at grain boundaries, as detected by STEM/EDX analysis.
C1 NIPPON NUCL FUEL DEV CO LTD,OARAI,IBARAKI 31113,JAPAN.
   HITACHI LTD,HITACHI WORKS,HITACHI 317,JAPAN.
RP NAKAHIGASHI, S (reprint author), TOSHIBA CO LTD,NUCL ENGN LAB,ISOGO KU,YOKOHAMA 235,JAPAN.

   HAYASHI, K
TI ION-PAIRING OF RADICAL IONS OF AROMATIC ALKENES AND ALKYNES STUDIED BY
   PULSE-RADIOLYSIS
SO BULLETIN OF THE CHEMICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
ID QUATERNARY AMMONIUM-SALTS; TRANS-STILBENE; DECAY KINETICS; ANIONS;
   TETRAHYDROFURAN; CATIONS; TETRABUTYLAMMONIUM; CL
AB Pulse radiolysis of 1,2-dichloroethane solutions of trans,trans-1,4-bis(2-phenylethenyl)benzene and 1,4-bis(2-phenylethynyl)benzene was undertaken in the presence of Bu4NPF6 (Bu = butyl) to investigate the effect of ion pairing of the solute radical cations with PF6-.  It was also undertaken for the tetrahydrofuran solutions of the above compounds in the presence of Bu4NPF6 and NaBPh4, where the solute radical anions are generated and form ion pairs with Bu4N+ and Na+.  The decay of the radical ions, which is due to neutralization, is retarded by the ion pairing.  The rate constants for the neutralization reactions in the free-ion and ion-paired states were determined.  Also presented are the data for the radical ions of trans-stilbene, diphenylacetylene, trans,trans-1,4-diphenyl-1,3-butadiene, and diphenylbutadiyne.  The radical ions of the aromatic alkynes are less stabilized by the ion pairing than those of the aromatic alkenes having the same carbon skeletons probably because of more extensive charge delocalization of the former radical ions.  Spectral shifts to shorter wave-lengths caused by the ion pairing are appreciable for the radical anions.  Dependence of the spectral shifts on the size of the radical anions is described.
C1 OSAKA UNIV,INST SCI & IND RES,8-1 MIHOGAOKA,IBARAKI,OSAKA 567,JAPAN.

TI LONG-HAUL COHERENT OPTICAL FIBER COMMUNICATION-SYSTEMS USING OPTICAL
   AMPLIFIERS
SO JOURNAL OF LIGHTWAVE TECHNOLOGY
LA English
DT Article
ID TRANSMISSION
AB Studies on long-haul coherent optical fiber communication systems with in-line optical amplifier repeaters are made theoretically and experimentally.  By theoretical calculation it was found that coherent systems can achieve wider dynamic range for an amplifier input power as compared with the intensity-modulation direct-detection (IMDD) systems.  Then, the feasibility of such systems using traveling-wave semiconductor laser amplifiers (TWSLA's) and erbium-doped fiber amplifiers (EDFA's) were investigated and 546 km, 140 Mb/s CPFSK transmission using TWSLA's and 1028 km 560 Mb/s CPFSK transmission using EDFA's were successfully demonstrated.

TI INSITU MONITORING FOR MESOPHASE FORMATION PROCESSES OF VARIOUS PITCHES
   BY MEANS OF HIGH-TEMPERATURE C-13-NMR
SO CARBON
LA English
DT Article
AB High-temperature heating processes for coal-tar-derived (pitch A), petroleum-derived pitch (pitch B), and hydrogenated petroleum-derived pitch (pitch C) have been studied by in-situ high-temperature C-13-NMR.  Mesophase formation processes have been successfully monitored for all three kinds of pitches.  The times required for appearance of mesophase in pitches A and B are similar and shorter than that in pitch C at 430-degrees-C.  Time intervals from mesophase appearance to finishing mesophase transformation in pitches B and C are nearly the same and shorter than that in pitch A at 430-degrees-C.  There may be a critical region of aliphatic carbon content for mesophase appearance of petroleum-derived pitch.  Completion of mesophase development correlates to the line-width of characteristic peak of 180 ppm assigned as carbon in stacked aromatic layer molecules.  Aliphatic carbons of molecules in mesophase seem to cause an increase of mesophase mobility and a narrowing of the characteristic peak for mesophase around 180 ppm.

SO CHEMISTRY LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID LOW-TEMPERATURE CHARACTERIZATION; WITTIG REACTION
AB Epoxides were converted to the corresponding optically active 2- and 3-hydroxyalkylphosphonium salts by the reaction with triphenylphosphine and dibenzoyltartaric acid (or camphorsulfonic acid), and with methylenetriphenylphosphorane and this acid, followed by fractional recrystallization, respectively. TI EFFECT OF LITHIUM-CARBONATE ON THE PARTIAL DISCHARGE IN ELECTRIC
   INSULATING POLYMER
SO KOBUNSHI RONBUNSHU
LA Japanese
DT Article
DE PARTIAL DISCHARGE; LOW DENSITY POLYETHYLENE; LITHIUM CARBONATE; CARBONYL
   GROUP; DISCHARGE PULSE; POLARIZING MICROSCOPE; INORGANIC POWDER;
   SPHERULITE
AB The restraint of partial discharge and deterioration by partial discharge of low density polyethylene at high voltages was achieved by heating the low density polyethylene with the lithium carbonate powder.  The lowest repetition rate of discharge pulse was observed with various inorganic powders (1%).  The addition of the lithium carbonate powder showed the lowest extent of carbonyl group (1715 cm-1) formation.  Further, the relationship between this inorganic powder and spherulite of low density polyethylene was examined by a polarizing microscope.  The growth of spherulite (large maltese cross, diameter 15 approximately 20-mu-m) was also restrained in the low density polyethylene by lithium carbonate.

TI STUDIES OF AQUEOUS RESINS .3. DISPERSION OF CRYSTALLINE POLYESTERS
   HAVING POLAR GROUPS
SO KOBUNSHI RONBUNSHU
LA Japanese
DT Article
DE POLYESTER; HYDROPHILIC GROUP; HYDROPHOBIC CHARACTER; DISPERSION;
   PARTICLE SIZE; CRYSTALLINITY; STABILITY
ID SATURATED POLYESTERS
AB Dispersion properties of hydrophobic polyesters can be controlled by introducing small amounts of hydrophilic groups into the polymer skeleton.  Such crystalline polyesters were prepared by introducing a few mol% of sodium 5-sulfonatoisophthalic acid.  The copolyester solutions in 2-butoxyethanol formed stable dispersions with particle sizes under 1000 nm by adding water.  Dispersibilities and stabilities of the dispersions were discussed in terms of the heat of fusion and the melting and softening points of the copolyesters used.

TI REVERSING-PULSE ELECTRIC BIREFRINGENCE OF POLY(GAMMA-BENZYL L-GLUTAMATE)
   .5. FIELD-INDUCED CHANGES OF ELECTRIC AND HYDRODYNAMIC PROPERTIES IN
   HELIX-FORMING SOLVENTS AS REVEALED BY TRANSIENT SIGNALS
SO POLYMER JOURNAL
LA English
DT Article
DE REVERSING-PULSE ELECTRIC BIREFRINGENCE; POLY(GAMMA-BENZYL L-GLUTAMATE);
   FIELD EFFECT; ELECTRO-HYDRODYNAMIC PROPERTY; AREA METHOD
ID METHANOL-WATER MIXTURES; BENZYL-L-GLUTAMATE; AQUEOUS-SOLUTIONS;
   POLY(L-GLUTAMIC ACID); COIL TRANSITION; CONFORMATIONAL CHANGE;
   FRACTIONATED SAMPLES; MOLECULAR-WEIGHT; DILUTE-SOLUTION; DIPOLE-MOMENTS
AB Reversing-pulse electric birefringence (RPEB) of poly(gamma-benzyl L-glutamate), [Glu(OBz)]n, with a weight-average molecular weight of 1.71 x 10(5) was measured at 20-degrees-C and at 535 nm in helix-forming organic solvents in the low field strength region (0-5 k V cm-1), with an emphasis on the transient signal.  The theoretical formalism was given for detecting the effect of an applied electric pulse field on reversible change in the electric and hydrodynamic properties of [Glu(OBz)]n from the normalized signal profiles, areas, and initial slopes of an RPEB signal.  A standard experimental procedure was given for unraveling the field-induced change of the electric and hydrodynamic parameters, by utilizing the areas of buildup (A(B)), reverse (A(R)), and decay (A(D)) processes at the limiting low field.  The area ratio, A(B)/[(1/2)A(R) + A(D)] = 1, should hold regardless of the degree of polydispersity of a sample, if no direct field effect on polymer conformation is present.  The ratio was found to be 0.95 in cyclohexanone, 0.93 in 2-chloroethanol, 0.81 in pyridine, and 0.74-0.81 in chloroform, all being less than unity.  Thus, the electric moments and/or the chain length of the [Glu(OBz)]n helix were verified to change reversibly to varying extent during the electric field orientation.

TI OBSERVATIONS OF CUMULENE CARBENES, H2CCCC AND H2CCC, IN TMC-1
SO PUBLICATIONS OF THE ASTRONOMICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
DE DARK CLOUD CHEMISTRY; INTERSTELLAR MOLECULES; TMC-1
ID LABORATORY DETECTION; ASTRONOMICAL IDENTIFICATION; INTERSTELLAR CLOUDS;
   MOLECULAR CLOUDS; C3H2; CYCLOPROPENYLIDENE; DARK
AB The carbon chain molecule H2CCCC was detected in the dark cloud TMC-1 for the first time in the course of a molecular line survey using the Nobeyama 45-m telescope. From nine transitions observed in the frequency region of 17-45 GHz, the total column density of H2CCCC in TMC-1 was derived to be 7.5(+/- 2.0) X 10(12) cm-2, which is about half of the value reported in IRC + 10216. Five transitions of a related carbon chain molecule, H2CCC, were also detected in TMC-1. The column density of H2CCC obtained in TMC-1, 2.8(+/- 0.9) x 10(12) cm-2, is a factor of three smaller than that of H2CCCC. The ortho-to-para abundance ratios of H2CCCC and H2CCC were found to be 4.2(+/- 1.5) and 5.9(+/- 2.0), respectively. The chemical reactions of these carbon-chain molecules in dark clouds are discussed.
C1 UNIV TOKYO,FAC SCI,DEPT CHEM,BUNKYO KU,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.
   NAGOYA UNIV,SCH SCI,DEPT ASTROPHYS,CHIKUSA KU,NAGOYA 46401,JAPAN.

   ISODA, S
TI INTEGRATED CASE SYSTEM USING DESIGN INFORMATION REPOSITORY
SO NTT REVIEW
LA English
DT Article
AB To improve software quality and productivity, it is important to make good use of various kinds of information concerning the software under development and to integrate the CASE tools which generate this information.  The software design automation system SoftDA consistently manages design information by means of a repository manager named SoftDA/DR (Software Design Automation/Design Information Repository).  The manager provides integrated information management which allows various kinds of information and program code to be stored with their interrelated elements, a browsing function which facilitates understanding of the design information definition through predefined forms, and automatic registration of the design information generated by SoftDA tools.  This paper describes the basic concepts and characteristics of the software design information repository.
RP YAMAMOTO, S (reprint author), NIPPON TELEGRAPH & TEL PUBL CORP,SOFTWARE LABS,TOKYO,JAPAN.

TC 0
Z9 0

TI WORK FUNCTION AND MICROSTRUCTURE OF A MONOATOMIC ORDER SURFACE-LAYER
   GROWN ON A (W-SC2W3O12)-COATED IMPREGNATED CATHODE
SO VACUUM
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 11TH INTERNATIONAL VACUUM CONGRESS ( IVC-11 ) / 7TH INTERNATIONAL CONF
   ON SOLID SURFACES ( ICSS-7 )
CY SEP 25-29, 1989
CL COLOGNE, FED REP GER
ID TUNGSTEN THIN-FILM; SC2O3
AB Activation processes of a (W-Sc2W3O12)-coated impregnated cathode are clarified by analysing the change in coated film structure before and after activation, the change in atom concentration on the cathode surface as well as the work function of the cathode during activation processes, and the activation time required to attain electron emission enhancement.  It is found that there are three steps necessary to complete the activation of the cathode; (1)  separation of Sc2W3O12 from W in the coated film; (2)  production of free Sc atoms as a result of the reaction between Sc2W3O12 and Ba atoms from the substrate cathode; and 93) formation of an ordered monoatomic surface layer composed of Ba, Sc and O.  It is also found that the overall activation energy is about 4.6 eV, and the work function after activation is about 1.15 eV.
RP YAMAMOTO, S (reprint author), HITACHI LTD,CENT RES LAB,KOKUBUNJI,TOKYO 185,JAPAN.
CR Nesmeyanov AN, 1963, VAPOR PRESSURE CHEM
   YAMAMOTO S, 1988, JPN J APPL PHYS 1, V27, P1411, DOI 10.1143/JJAP.27.1411
   YAMAMOTO S, 1986, JPN J APPL PHYS 1, V25, P971, DOI 10.1143/JJAP.25.971
   YAMAMOTO S, 1989, JPN J APPL PHYS 1, V28, P490, DOI 10.1143/JJAP.28.490
   YAMAMOTO S, 1989, JPN J APPL PHYS 2, V28, pL865, DOI 10.1143/JJAP.28.L865
   YAMAMOTO S, 1987, J VAC SCI TECHNOL A, V5, P1299, DOI 10.1116/1.574795
